Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
blocks nVersion is an int32 ... 
So we can flag blocks above nversion 7,000,000 with the verison = 7M + vout location of notarisation in the block.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: i like the idea of re-utilizing the nVersion field as a sort of "onchain notarization-pointer"!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I got it to kind of work. At leat I think its possible

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: `VALID NOTARISATION connect block.40004 tx.1`

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: At the very last step of conenct block ... if the `nVersion-7M != tx`  then the block can be invalid.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So the commission just needs to check the one tx flagged by nVersion

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: If the actual notaristion is invalid... Then it can be rejected later

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This should allow block validation to contain a coinbase based on the notarisation tx without having to check if the notarisraion is valid before the data is calcualted

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: lots more work to do, but I think creating the block is the easy part. Code to check comission of block should be the same as what creates it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: as long as the tx used to calculate the comission (notary payout) matches the valid notarisation, then it seems fine..

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This one is going to be hard to test... Need to make invalid notarisations lol
